text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in kitchen I want to show you
how to make what I like to call my
overnight pumpkin French Toast Casserole
it is so wonderful
it's delicious now I think this can be
served as a dessert because it's kind of
like a bread pudding type of thing it's
delicious but what's really great about
it is that you I call it overnight
because truly you can assemble this and
pop it in the fridge overnight and then
the next morning you bake it before
you're ready to serve it for lunch for
brunch or breakfast but it's also really
great if you just leave it in the fridge
for a couple of hours so either one will
do but I say overnight because it's
better the longer I can stay the better
and what's better on a holiday morning
you wake up and you just pop this into
the oven the house smells fantastic get
a pot of coffee going a little bit of

wonderful family breakfast indulgent but
who cares
it's holiday season let me live let's go

here is a mixture of heavy cream and
whole milk you need eggs some pure
pumpkin puree granulated sugar you need
brown sugar pumpkin pie spice
I've got vanilla extract a little bit of
orange and you need some bread now you
know that I love to use for either
french toast or any bread pudding of any
sort and love to use challah bread
challah bread is a lovely really eggy
bread slightly sweet it's fantastic I
like it to go stale for about a day or
two before I use it because I feel like
it absorbs everything better and gives
you a better texture so what I've done
is I could just kind of cut my challah
bread into large chunks like that and
I've placed them in a large buttered
casserole dish set that aside get
working on your batter this is really
kind of just a small tweak on my classic
baked french toast recipe and this is
what I want you to know as a home cook
it's always great to have basic recipes
like for example a custard for a french
toast or custard for a bread pudding or
now cupcakes or whatever whatever it is
it's always great to have a basic recipe
like a base that you can turn to over
and over again and just play around with
flavors and then before you know it
you've got a wonderful new recipe with a
base you already know and trust and for
a home cook because you know I don't
want to call myself a chef because I'm
not one but for a home cook it is key to
making great dishes having a ton of
different varieties if you just have
those basics in your repertoire okay
pretty much adding everything in I mean
it's really simple and really easy I
need a little bit of vanilla I need to

like orange or overwhelming like orange
so I would say maybe a half of an orange
a quarter of an orange you don't have to

raisins whatever you fancy and just
